intro: Knautia petrovicii, commonly known as the Carpathian knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains in Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat. Knautia petrovicii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
